By Debauch on Friday, August 17, 2001 - 09:54 pm:

I tend to use the album, band or song title for naming monsters, to make it easier to remember what disc they came from, and then when naming a new monster, I'll combine words from the parents or grandparent's names...Sometimes I get creative so that a name I like will fit, like Strych9 Kiss.
My original joker was made combining Johnny Cash- Murder, a pink eye I named "Cocaine Blues" with a clear suezo, off of the Robert Johnson box set, named "Devil Blues", so I got "Devil Cocaine", and now "Devil Mayhem". I also had a centaur named "Spasm Sam", from Skinny Puppy and Bauhaus.
And I had a tropical ape named "RapeN'Honey" from Ministry's "Land of Rape and Honey" which I combined with a monol off a X-mas cd, making "RapeN'Xmas". I have an odd sense of humor.

Tip for Pokemon lovers: You can use Pokemon names to in your Monster rancher monsters, just see:

Dragon = Charizard
Ducken = Psyduck
Plant/Monol = Vileplume
Mew = Meowth
Phoenix = Moltres
Blue Phoenix = Articuno
Gaboo = Muk
Golem = Golem (duh)
Tiger/Monol = Houndoom
Zilla = That whale Pokemon

And some other more forced names.

Also, a good Phoenix name would be Fire Chicken. ;_)

MR2

Even better ones, now. My dad named a Dragon from a tusk Salutations, because he combined H and I, from the market.
